title: AR-Enhanced Academic Library Navigation and Information Literacy Competency Development Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone usage skills and foundational understanding of library services
context.additional_context: Participants are primarily job seekers or self-directed learners, utilizing non-real-time educational environments with augmented reality content accessible via smartphones

learning_goals: Learners can explore key spaces and resources in the academic library in 360 degrees using an augmented reality app.
Learners can perform core information literacy procedures—such as literature search, borrowing, and citation—through AR-based simulations.
Learners can submit project outcomes based on real-world library usage scenarios to their digital portfolios.

resources: AR Content Embedding Functionality in LMS
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
